metadata.title: CVE-2018-10852 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: The UNIX pipe which sudo uses to contact SSSD and read the available sudo rules from SSSD has too wide permissions, which means that anyone who can send a message using the same raw protocol that sudo and SSSD use can read the sudo rules available for any user. This affects versions of SSSD before 1.16.3.

criterions.comment: sssd package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.2-1').
